description.en: International law is traditionally concerned with inter-state relations, but nowadays it involves likewise international organisations and to a lesser extent also natural and legal persons. The course provides a broad understanding of the central principles and main branches of international law, for example, jurisdiction, immunity, state responsibility, peaceful settlement of disputes, law of treaties, diplomatic law, law of the sea and use of armed force. In addition to the theoretical foundation, relevant practices of states, courts and international organisations are examined in connection with discussed topics.
description.et: Rahvusvaheline õigus käsitleb klassikaliselt riikidevahelisi suhteid, kuid tänapäeval puudutab selle regulatsioon veel rahvusvahelisi organisatsioone ning vähemal määral ka füüsilisi ja juriidilisi isikuid. Õppeaine annab üldised teadmised rahvusvahelise õiguse põhimõtetest ja selle peamistest harudest, nt jurisdiktsioon, immuniteet, vastutus, vaidluste rahumeelne lahendamine, lepingute õigus, diplomaatiline ja konsulaarõigus, mereõigus, inimõigused ning relvastatud jõu kasutamine. Jooksvalt vaadeldakse ka Ühinenud Rahvaste Organisatsiooniga seonduvaid küsimusi. Läbitavate teemade puhul käsitletakse lisaks teoreetilisele baasile ka asjakohast riikide, kohtute ja rahvusvaheliste organisatsioonide praktikat

objectives.en: To provide a broad understanding of the central principles and main branches of international law, and to develop the skills necessary to assess the conduct of international actors from international law perspective
objectives.et: Anda laialdane arusaam rahvusvahelise õiguse kesksetest põhimõtetest ja peamistest harudest ning arendada oskusi, mis on vajalikud, et hinnata rahvusvaheliste toimijate käitumist lähtuvalt rahvusvahelisest õigusest

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has passed the course is able to:
— Explain the central principles of international law
— Describe the sources of international law
— Understand the relation between international and national legal systems
learning_outcomes.et: — Mõistab rahvusvahelise ja siseriikliku õiguse suhet

learning_outcomes.en: — Identify the subjects of international law
— Find and apply the substantive regulation of the main branches of international law
learning_outcomes.et: — Leiab ja rakendab rahvusvahelise õiguse peamiste harude sisulist regulatsiooni
— Lahendab rahvusvahelist õigust puudutavaid hüpoteetilisi kaasusi

independent_work.en:
— Write a research paper where the student analyses critically a legal problem in international law.
— The selected topic must be registered via Moodle (using the messaging function) no later than on 11 November. The instructor may ask the student to choose another topic if the chosen topic is not suitable or someone has already chosen the same problem. The paper must be submitted electronically as a Word-file no later than on 9 December at 1200 (noon) via Moodle. For every started overdue day, the result will be decreased by three points, but papers which are late more than four days are not accepted and the student may not take the exam. The instructor does not consider papers sent by email.
— The paper must include title page, table of content, main body and list of used materials. For references, use footnotes. The length of main text (starting from the introduction and ending with the conclusion, excluding footnotes) should be 2000-2500 words. Shorter papers are not accepted or the result is lowered by the discretion of the instructor.
— Independent identification of clear issues and legal problems is very important. Also, the use of different sources and supportive materials. All used sources must be referred to. In case of internet sources, the full address is necessary, not only the main domain (for example, www.un.org). A paper based on copy-paste method leads to negative results for both the paper and the exam. Plagiarism is not tolerated at the University of Tartu.

grade_preconditions.en: Timely submission and positive evaluation of the research paper

grade_evaluation.en:
— Research paper (30 points)
— Written exam with three types of questions (multiple-choice questions, theoretical concepts, hypothetical cases) (70 points)

A.en: Answers to theoretical questions are remarkable; the examination of hypothetical cases is full, logical and creative; the analysis of legal problems is detailed and innovative; all relevant norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice are thoughtful and creative; the form is excellent; overall, the text is a remarkable achievement (91-100 points)

B.en: Answers to theoretical questions are very good with insignificant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is purposeful and creative; the analysis of legal problems is very good with insignificant deficiencies; necessary norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice support the conclusions; the form is very good; overall, the treatment of the subject is logical and smooth (81-90 points)

C.en: Answers to theoretical questions are good, but there are mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases addresses correctly the central issues; the analysis of legal problems is good with some deficiencies concerning specific issues; key norms and principles have been used; the form is good; overall, the coverage of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses from the point of view of the whole (71-80 points)

D.en: Answers to theoretical questions are fair, but there are several mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is satisfactory, but focuses only on the central aspects; the analysis of legal problems is satisfactory with deficiencies is most aspects; only basic norms and principles have been used; the form is fair; overall, the treatment of the subject is plausible, but insecure (61-70 points)

E.en: Answers to theoretical questions are poor with significant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is weak and limited only to the very basic aspects; the analysis of legal problems is shallow with significant deficiencies is most aspects; only some rudimentary norms and principles have been used; overall, the coverage of the subject suffers of superficial treatment, poor knowledge of law and unsound presentation (51-60 points)
